How will the frame names be handled? Do they need to be unique across all models? A nested model example:

~~~
<model name="model1">
  <frame name="f_model">
    <pose frame="world">1 0 0 0 0 0</pose>
  </frame>
  <pose frame="f_model">0 0 0 0 0 0</pose>
  
  <model name="model2">
    <frame name="f_model">
      <pose frame="world">0 0 1 0 0 0</pose>
    </frame>
    <pose frame="f_model">0 0 0 0 0 0</pose>

    <link name="link">
      <frame name="f_link">
        <pose frame="f_model">0 0 2 0 0 0</pose>
      </frame>
      <pose frame="f_link">0 1 0 0 0 0</pose>
    </link>
  </model>
   
  <model name="model3">
    <frame name="f_model">
      <pose frame="world">2 0 0 0 0 0</pose>
    </frame>
    <pose frame="f_model">0 0 0 0 0 0</pose>

    <link name="link">
      <frame name="f_link">
        <pose frame="f_model">0 0 2 0 0 0</pose>
      </frame>
      <pose frame="f_link">0 1 0 0 0 0</pose>
    </link>
  </model>   

</model>
~~~

* SDF allows links within different models to have the same name, visuals within different links to have the same name and so on. Would this be supported for frames as well? When you say the definition of frames is independent of the hierarchy, I think there would be many collisions.

* Probably most models will be declared with a frame with respect to the world. What happens when they are nested into other models? Does the user need to expand the model and change that? (actually this might be a nested models question) My point here is that the concept of a "parent" frame might be handy - so the frame would be expressed with respect to whatever it is embedded into.
